item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 is Getting a New Zombies Map in April
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/call-of-duty-black-ops-6-is-getting-a-new-zombies-map-in-april/

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 will receive the new ‘Shattered Veil’ map in Zombies mode on April 2, 2025. 

Call of Duty has just released its Season 3 Zombies trailer, which features the brand new Shattered Veil map. The new map is set in an overrun mansion, where players will find several hidden secrets to uncover. It is a massive mansion with a bunch of rooms, gadgets, and trinkets to explore. However, the central mystery lies in the basement. Shattered Veil will be available as a free content update for all players. 

Season 3 is shaping up to be one of the most eventful updates for Call of Duty, with new content arriving on all fronts. Black Ops 6 Zombies is getting the Shattered Veil map, Warzone will see the return of Verdansk, and Firing Range, one of the most beloved COD maps, is also returning to Black Ops 6 on April 2. 

Moreover, the developers recently confirmed that Black Ops 6 fans will be able to jump into Season 3 content 24 hours early. However, during that time, Warzone will be going offline to prepare for the return of Verdansk on April 3. Players who open the Call of Duty: Warzone game menu at the time can claim the Kilo 141 for free. 

Furthermore, Warzone Season 3 is bringing some gameplay changes, too. The developers recently revealed that the title is receiving exclusive movement changes, which will be inspired by Omnimovement but fine-tuned for Warzone. 

In other news, Call of Duty 2025 planned to have six fully-fledged round-based maps for the Zombies mode. What are your thoughts on the new Black Ops 6 Zombies Map, Shattered Veil? Let us know in the comments or on our community forum!

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Monster Energy Supercross 25’s Career Mode. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: College Football 25 Added To EA Play And Xbox Game Pass
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/college-football-25-added-to-ea-play-and-xbox-game-pass/

EA Sports College Football 25 is now available for EA Play and Xbox Game Pass subscribers.

In an announcement made on via Xbox Wire, the most successful sports game in United States history, is available for all EA Play subscribers, and, in turn, subscribers to Xbox Game Pass Ultimate.

“Starting today, players can chase greatness with their favorite collegiate teams in EA Sports College Football 25 – now on the Play List,” the post reads. “There’s no better time to step into legendary stadiums and experience the unforgettable traditions that make college football legendary.”

Since its release in July—the first College Football game since NCAA Football 14—, College Football 25 has been one of the best-selling games in the United States. The game finished just behind Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 for the best-selling game of the year. As mentioned, however, it did become the best-selling sports game of all time, surpassing NBA 2K21.

The next installment in the series, College Football 26 is expected to release in July and will feature the return of real-life coaches to the game. More details on the game will be announced in the coming months.

Are you going to check out College Football 25 now that its available on EA Play and Xbox Game Pass? Let us know down below, and join more discussions in the official Insider Gaming forums.

For more Insider Gaming, check out the nerfs coming to the two hardest bosses in The First Berserker: Khazan. And don’t forget to sign up for our newsletter.
